snippet: The Bulgarian Chess Federation punished Borislav Ivanov, who has been accused of using computer programs to win, after he did not show up for a test of his skills
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column examines suspension of Bulgarian player Borislav Ivanov for four months; Ivanov has long been suspected of cheating and was suspended after he failed to show up for a Bulgarian Chess Federation test of his skills.
lead_paragraph: The Bulgarian Chess Federation punished Borislav Ivanov, who has been accused of using computer programs to win, after he did not show up for a test of his skills

headline.main: Player Suspected of Cheating Is Suspended for 4 Months
headline.print_headline: Player Suspected of Cheating Is Suspended for 4 Months
